text:
After installing openssl-0.9.6c with ./configure shared per bug 8034 and 
contacting Allen Chen and users group for advice, apache will not configure 
without errors. This appears to be a symbol problem like bug 8034 but I can't 
figure out a workaround. What do I need to fix this issue? If I ignore and 
continue throught the install I get a core dump when trying to startssl.

configure:9120: result: checking dependencies
configure:9125: checking for SSL/TLS toolkit base
configure:9187: result: /usr/local/ssl

configure:9192: result:

configure:9231: result: /usr/local/ssl/lib

D_POSIX_PTHREAD_SEMANTICS -D_REENTRANT -L/usr/local/ss
l/lib -R/usr/local/ssl/lib conftest.c -lsendfile -lrt -lm -liconv -lsocket -
lnsl -lresolv  -ldl -lssl -lcrypto >&5
/
#else
f = SSL_set_state;
#endif

  ;
  return 0;
}

creator: jl1@gty.ci.henderson.nv.us

text: Please try again with 2.0.40 to see if this problem persists.
creator: slive@apache.org

text: No response from submittor, assuming problem was resolved by 2.0.40.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
